title.narrative: 4.3 SP - SOCIAL INCLUSION

description.narrative: 104/003 By 2020, social policy partners have increased capacity to develop and implement policies to advocate, innovate, engage communities and allocate resources to issues that affect the realisation of the rights of the child., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Environmental Sustainability, Evaluation And Research, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, an enhanced policy environment and national and sub-national systems are in place for the realization of child rights, with a focus on equity, guided by knowledge and evidence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 104/003 By 2020, social policy partners have increased capacity to develop and implement policies to advocate, innovate, engagecommunities and allocate resources to issues that affect the realisation of the rights of the child.

description.narrative: UNICEF advocated for accelerated investment for children.; A ‘Child Sensitive Social Protection Policy Unit’ was established at the Cabinet Division to implement the National Social Security Strategy.Children’s needs and their vulnerabilities were better identified through the national and child multi-dimensional poverty analyses. An electronic result monitoring mechanism was established. Studies, including the mapping of child-sensitive social protection programmes, simulation of social protection budget for poverty reduction, social protection in the context of changing demographics informed the preparation of the 8th Five-Year Plan.;; These key accomplishments helped further advance a solid social protection mechanism in Bangladesh. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:23/12/2021
